column4: how do you start-up ubuntu on a mac os 8 - I put the cd in and on boot up it said rebuilding desktop image then nothing happened - anyone have any ideas
are you talking about a old world machine?
what makes something an old world machine?
what is the machine's name/type you want to install ubuntu on? (like e.g. "Powerbook G3 Series)
it is just a G3 from like 6 yrs ago with mac os 8
one of the beige tower systems?
ummm...it is green and clear colored
ok. that's actually better then beige in more than one way :-) let me check something...
ok, that's a "bondi blue" or rather "blue and white" G3
so: fl how do we get the ubuntu os to fire up
this one has "Open Firmware", which you can access at boot with apple+alt+o+f
ok, that means that you should be using the "yaboot" boot manager
and, if you put the CD in, and press and hold "c" during the boot, your machine should start from the Ubuntu CD
so fl: I reboot the machine and hit apple+alt+o+f
put in the Ubuntu CD, and press and hold "c" during the boot,  your machine should start from the Ubuntu CD
